hgr::Visual Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Visual.h>

Inheritance diagram for hgr::Visual:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base class for objects to be rendered on screen.

Member Function Documentation

const math::float3& hgr::Visual::boundBoxMax (   )  const
 

Gets bounding box maximum of the visual in model space.

Requires that bounding box has been set with setBoundBox(). Value ranges are between [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND].

const math::float3& hgr::Visual::boundBoxMaxWorld (   )  const
 

Gets bounding box maximum of the visual in world space.

Requires that bounding box has been set with setBoundBoxWorld(). Value ranges are between [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND].

const math::float3& hgr::Visual::boundBoxMin (   )  const
 

Gets bounding box minimum of the visual in model space.

Requires that bounding box has been set with setBoundBox(). Value ranges are between [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND].

const math::float3& hgr::Visual::boundBoxMinWorld (   )  const
 

Gets bounding box minimum of the visual in world space.

Requires that bounding box has been set with setBoundBoxWorld(). Value ranges are between [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND].

virtual void hgr::Visual::computeBound (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Computes bounding volume of the visual in model space.

Implemented in hgr::Console, hgr::Lines, hgr::Mesh, and hgr::ParticleSystem.

void hgr::Visual::getBodyTransform (  math::float3x4 *  bodyworldtm,
math::float3x4 *  bodytm = 0,
math::float3x4 *  bodyvertextm = 0
)  const
 

Returns transformations which remove world space scaling and move pivot to geometric center.

Useful for example to setup rigid body simulations and other applications which do not tolerate scaling and require pivot to be in geometric center.

Parameters:
bodyworldtm [out] Receives geometric pivot transformation in uniformly scaled world space (ptr can be 0 if value not needed).
bodytm [out] Visual world transform multiplied with this results uniform world transform (ptr can be 0 if value not needed).
bodyvertextm [out] Visual vertex transformed with this results a vertex compatible with uniform world transform (ptr can be 0 if value not needed).

virtual void hgr::Visual::getShaders (  lang::Array< gr::Shader * > &  shaders  )  [pure virtual]
 

Returns array of shaders used by this visual.

NOTE: Implementation should not clear the list of returned shaders before adding new ones, since shadesr from multiple Visuals might be collected at the same time.

Implemented in hgr::Console, hgr::Lines, hgr::Mesh, and hgr::ParticleSystem.

bool hgr::Visual::isBoundInfinity (   )  const
 

Returns true if this Visual's bounding volumes is infinite, i.e.

visual is always visible.

bool hgr::Visual::isBoundWorld (   )  const
 

Returns true if this Visual's bounding volumes are defined in world space (instead of default, model space).

virtual void hgr::Visual::render (  gr::Context *  context,
Camera *  camera,
int  priority
)  [pure virtual]
 

Renders this visual to the rendering context.

Parameters:
context Rendering context.
camera Active camera.
priority Shader priority level which is to be rendered.

Implemented in hgr::Console, hgr::Lines, hgr::Mesh, and hgr::ParticleSystem.

bool hgr::Visual::renderable (   )  const
 

Returns true if rendering is enabled for this visual.

Default is enabled.

void hgr::Visual::setBoundBox (  const math::float3 &  boxmin,
const math::float3 &  boxmax
) 
 

Sets bounding box minimum and maximum of the visual in model space.

Value ranges are between [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND]. World space bounding box and model space bounding box are mutually exclusive.

void hgr::Visual::setBoundBoxWorld (  const math::float3 &  boxmin,
const math::float3 &  boxmax
) 
 

Sets bounding box minimum and maximum of the visual in world space.

Value ranges are between [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND]. World space bounding box and model space bounding box are mutually exclusive.

void hgr::Visual::setBoundInfinity (   ) 
 

Sets 'infinite' bounding box.

'Infinite' bounding box is equal to [-MAX_BOUND,MAX_BOUND] size. Infinite box is considered to be defined in world space.

void hgr::Visual::setRenderable (  bool  enabled  ) 
 

Toggles rendering for this visual.

Default is enabled.

Maximum bounding volume size.
